org.sakaiproject.util

Class SingleStorageSqlOracle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sakaiproject.util.SingleStorageSqlDefault
      • org.sakaiproject.util.SingleStorageSqlOracle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SingleStorageSql

    public class SingleStorageSqlOracle
extends SingleStorageSqlDefault
    methods for accessing single storage data in an oracle database.

      Object[] getXmlFields(int first, int last)
      returns an array of objects needed for the getXmlSql statement with limits.
      String getXmlSql(String field, String table, int first, int last)
      returns the sql statement which retrieves the xml field from the specified table and limits the result set.
      String getXmlWhereLimitSql(String selectBy, String orderBy, String tableName, int first, int maxCount)
      returns the SQL statement which retrieves a limited number of rows selected by a particular value for a specified field (the selectBy parameter) and returned in ascending order by another specified field (the orderBy parameter).

      • getXmlWhereLimitSql

        public String getXmlWhereLimitSql(String selectBy,
                         String orderBy,
                         String tableName,
                         int first,
                         int maxCount)
        returns the SQL statement which retrieves a limited number of rows selected by a particular value for a specified field (the selectBy parameter) and returned in ascending order by another specified field (the orderBy parameter). The limit on the number of rows is specified by values for the first item to be retrieved (indexed from 0) and the maxCount.
        Specified by:
        getXmlWhereLimitSql in interface SingleStorageSql
        Overrides:
        getXmlWhereLimitSql in class SingleStorageSqlDefault
        Parameters:
        selectBy - The name of a field to be used in a where clause with the value provided separately.
        orderBy - The name of a field to be used in an order-by clause
        tableName - The table on which the query is to operate
        first - A non-negative integer indicating the first record to return, indexed from 0.
        maxCount - A positive integer indicating the maximum number of records to return

      • getXmlFields

        public Object[] getXmlFields(int first,
                    int last)
        returns an array of objects needed for the getXmlSql statement with limits.
        Specified by:
        getXmlFields in interface SingleStorageSql
        Overrides:
